image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: The 29-year-old faces two counts of rape, alleged to have occurred in Toowoomba, west of Brisbane, in October 2021.

title.children: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann committed to stand trial on two counts of rape

image.altText: Black banners wave along the front of parliament.

props.synopsis: The public entrance to Parliament House is locked down after pro-Palestinian activists scaled the roof of the building and protesters glued themselves to the marble foyer. Follow live. Â

title.children: Pro-Palestinian activists scale roof of Parliament House as climate protesters glue themselves to foyer

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Protesters flying paper planes carrying messages
Investigation required into 'serious breach' of parliament security, Coalition says

image.altText: A logo for Amazon is displayed on a screen at the Nasdaq MarketSite, July 27, 2018.

props.synopsis: American technology giant Amazon will establish a "top secret" data cloud to store classified Australian military and intelligence information under a partnership with the federal government.

title.children: Amazon wins $2b contract to store 'top secret' Australian military intelligence

image.altText: A young woman wearing grey dress over black skivvy stands in front of a house, smiling with a mug in her hands

props.synopsis: Australian homes are notoriously cold in winter â€” draughty, with poor insulation, thin glass and inadequate heating. But there's a growing movement of people retrofitting their homes to make them cheaper to run and more comfortable year-round, while also reducing emissions.Â

title.children: Got an old, cold house like Laine's? Here are seven ways to make it warmer and cheaper

image.altText: Derelict terrace houses covered in graffiti.

props.synopsis: With official estimates putting the number of vacant and derelict homes above 100,000 across Australia, local governments and property lawyers argue they could be part of the solution to Australia's apparent housing shortage.

title.children: Up to 140,000 homes are sitting empty. What could be done to get people living in them again?

image.altText: Joe Biden yells mouth wide open with his fist in the air at a podium.

props.synopsis: This past week was arguably the worst of Joe Biden's 2024 campaign. And it might have been one of Donald Trump's best.Â

title.children: Biden's bad night has become a worse week. And for Trump, things keep getting better

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Police say the teenager stomped on the windscreen of a car as he left the scene of the alleged home invasion in Canberra.

title.children: Police say they identified teenager allegedly involved in home invasion because he was wearing school uniform

image.altText: Two older men in gray suits look concerned

props.synopsis: The last week of parliament before the winter recess can often be messy â€” and this week proved to be no exception for either Anthony Albanese or Peter Dutton.Â

title.children: All eyes are on Payman's future with Labor, but Dutton has his own woes playing out behind closed doors

image.altText: A collage of three rugby league players

props.synopsis: Almost 20 years ago, Elliott Whitehead was coached by Leon Pryce. Ten years ago they played together. This weekend, the Raiders veteran will face off against his dear mate's son in the rookie sensation's second NRL game.Â

title.children: This NRL warhorse learned the ropes alongside an English legend. Now, he'll try to take down his son

image.altText: a man of african descent stands behind a pool fence

props.synopsis: Tuck was sitting in the pool area of his own apartment complex when police arrested him, believing he was trespassing. He says it wouldn't have happened had it not been for his physical appearance.

title.children: 'Extraordinary overreaction': Man accuses police of racial profiling after arrest for trespassing at his own home

image.altText: Remote control dozers are helping seal the burning Grosvenor Coal Mine.

props.synopsis: Queensland's largest underground coal mine is on fire up to half a kilometre below ground. Remote control technology is helping in an around-the-clock race to seal the mine and avoid further explosions.

title.children: A coal mine fire has been burning for five days in central Queensland. There is only one way to put it out

image.altText: Amir Maimon looks down on the Press Club stage.

props.synopsis: Israeli ambassador Amir Maimon is reportedly summoned to a meeting in Canberra and warned his nation could not expect Australia's support if it goes to war with listed terror group Hezbollah in Lebanon.

title.children: Birmingham says government must explain Israeli ambassador call-in

image.altText: A close up image of a male teen with his hand over his face looking at a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Female teachers are being sworn at, sexually harassed and physically threatened in high schools by male students. They say young men are bringing the misogynistic ideas of Andrew Tate and other online influencers into the classroom.Â

title.children: 'Disgusting and disturbing': Why some female teachers are leaving the profession

image.altText: A swampy shallow creek with trees around.

props.synopsis: The shirt of a 12-year-old girl who has been missing since Tuesday and is suspected to have been taken by a crocodile in a remote Northern Territory creek is found upstream of where she went missing, police say.Â

title.children: Shirt belonging to girl feared taken by crocodile found in remote NT creek

image.altText: A professionally-dressed woman in a grey blazer stands on the property of a one-storey suburban home

props.synopsis: Landlords in New South Wales say a looming policy change by the state government to ban a practice known as "no-grounds evictions" will erode the rights of property owners and reduce the amount of rental stock on the market.Â

title.children: 'It's the landlord's property': Warning planned rental protections go too far

image.altText: A woman stands in a room with bookshelves behind her. She is looking up and has her hands on her hips.

props.synopsis: An audit of Queensland Fertility Group semen samples frozen before 2020 found thousands to be at high risk of misidentification because of a lack of double witnessing, a report by the state's health ombudsman says.

title.children: Major IVF clinic accused of using the wrong sperm asked to destroy thousands of samples

image.altText: Woman posing next to tree in garden

props.synopsis:
Hannah Ingram-Moore, the daughter of a British veteran who raised millions for the NHS, has been banned from being a trustee of a charity he set up before his death.

Â

title.children: Daughter of Captain Sir Tom banned from being charity trustee

image.altText: A muslim man in a white top looks at the camera, holding a jacket

props.synopsis: The convenor of The Muslim Vote movement Sheikh Wesam Charkawi plans to announce candidates for two federal seats currently held by Labor as early as next week, and says voters are turning away from the government due to its "weak" support for Palestinians.Â

title.children: Muslim Vote movement sets sights on two federal Labor seats in Western Sydney

image.altText: A number of beauty products placed on a vibrant pink display stand.

props.synopsis: Australian cosmetics giant MCoBeauty has attracted global attention for its strikingly similar beauty dupes, but the company has kept the details of its product development process out of the spotlight â€” until now.

title.children: We asked MCoBeauty to explain how they dupe cosmetics. They gave us a step-by-step guide

image.altText: A man standing on a balcony deck, looking over a swimming pool with large arid mountains and a blue sky beyond the propety

props.synopsis: Igal uses the online platform Booking.com to advertise his holiday apartment. But human rights lawyers want the practice banned and allege Booking.com is breaking international law.

title.children: It's a home with a serious view. But human rights lawyers say Booking.com should be banned from advertising it

image.altText: A drink on a bar with a few wedges of lime in it.

props.synopsis: Despite anecdotal information suggesting spiking is reasonably common, only seven people went to court charged with unlawful drink spiking in Queensland between July 2021 and May 2024.

title.children: 'This wasn't a rape, we can't test you': Woman says she was denied drink spiking test at Brisbane hospital

image.altText: Joe Biden gestures with both hands as he speaks from behind a lectern during a studio debate.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has vowed to continue his campaign for re-election in the 2024 US presidential race after a shaky debate performance with Republican Donald Trump.Â

title.children: Democratic governors express confidence in Joe Biden

image.altText: A young woman wearing thin glasses, light red lipstick and a grey hijab looks to her right in closeup

props.synopsis: The West Australian senator has told colleagues she is seeking religious guidance on her next move but is expected to make a decision on quitting her party today.Â

title.children: Payman decision expected as caucus colleagues express concern over claims she was being guided by 'God'

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis hits a forehand at Wimbledon

props.synopsis: Australia's Thanasi Kokkinakis takes two days â€” and five sets â€” to get through to the second round, Britain gets a mixed doubles dream team and Daniil Medvedev sits down a point early in a tie-break.

title.children: Five quick hits â€” Kokkinakis wins five-set epic, Murray-Raducanu to make mixed doubles dream team, Medvedev gets score wrong â€” and wins anyway

image.altText: Paralympics Australia chief Catherine Clark stands speaking in front of a number of microphones.

props.synopsis: The chief executive of Paralympics Australia â€” who has been on personal leave since last month â€” resigns from the post in the run-up to the Paris games.Â

title.children: Paralympics Australia says CEO resignation won't affect Paris performance

image.altText: Sunak speaks in front of a lectern emblazoned with the slogan "stop the boats".

props.synopsis: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has spent years fighting to send asylum seekers to an offshore detention facility. Not only has the plan failed, it's likely to help sweep his government out of office.

title.children: Britain's Tories copied Australia's 'stop the boats' policy. Now they're set to lose the election

image.altText: A person holds a bag of nitazenes powder.

props.synopsis: There are fears of more overdoses as nitazenes infiltrate Australia's underground drug supply, with occasional recreational drug users warned the synthetic opioid is being found in drugs like cocaine.

title.children: Nitazenes are coming into Australia from India and China. Their effects are deadly

image.altText: Art for TV series The Bear showing chefs Carmen and Syd emerging from kitchen doors where we see the cast

props.synopsis: The Bear has a reputation for having TV's best soundtrack. But does season three run the risk of repeating itself?

title.children: When The Bear is firing on all burners, it offers the finest soundtrack in contemporary television

image.altText: A stylish woman in a beige coat and jeans holds a large black handbag.

props.synopsis: Handbags, backpacks and other work bags may be tax deductible providing they comply with some rather strict rules.

title.children: Yes, you can claim a tax deduction for a bag â€” as long as you follow these rules

image.altText: Man sits in driver's seat.

props.synopsis: Wall Street has hit fresh highs off the back of major tech stocks, with the Australian share market expected to follow. Follow the day's events and insights as they happenÂ withÂ our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASIC report fallout continues, while ASX to rise as Tesla and Nvidia push up tech indexes on Wall Street

image.altText: Officers in forensics uniforms outside a house.

props.synopsis: Police say a synthetic opioid was detected in the systems of four people who died in a house in Broadmeadows, in Melbourne's north last week. A 17-year-old boy was among those who died.

title.children: Deaths of four people in Melbourne home linked to synthetic opioid, police say

image.altText: A Chinese coast guard ship is seen in the distance in the South China Sea.

props.synopsis: Taiwan's coast guard says the squid fishing boat was near the Taiwan-administered Kinmen islands but in Chinese waters when it was boarded and seized.Â

title.children: China seizes Taiwan fishing boat with crew near Chinese coast

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him in this illustration picture

props.synopsis: The hackers behind a major cyber attack on the Indonesian government issue a surprise apology and offer to release the stolen data.

title.children: 'Citizens of Indonesia, we apologise': Hackers offer to release keys following national ransomware attack

image.altText: A girl sits on the floor hunched in a corner next to a cupboard, peering over her knees.

props.synopsis: The 45-year-old stepfather also abused the victim's young sisters. He will be sentenced in WA later this year, but the case has raised disturbing questions about children's safety.

title.children: Child abuse victim 'begged for help', but WA Department of Communities failed to act

image.altText: A woman with short black hair sips a coffee.

props.synopsis: A steep hike in visa fees is pushing current and prospective international students to consider other universities outside of Australia.

title.children: 'Am I a cash cow?': Australia loses favour with international students after visa fee hike
